abstract: District attorneys across United States are weighing issue of when sending or distribution of nude pictures of minors by other minors constitutes child pornography violation that should be prosecuted, and when it is merely teenage folly; about 20 states have adopted laws addressing juvenile sexting by providing more moderate range of legal responses to personal photo-sharing; incidents at Canon City High School in Colorado have thrust issue into spotlight.
lead_paragraph: While trading raunchy photos can be viewed legally as violating child pornography laws, few prosecutors want to ruin a teenager’s life for a one-time display of immaturity.

headline.main: Prosecutors Weigh Teenage Sexting: Folly or Felony?
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Weigh Teenage Sexting: Folly or Felony?

snippet: While trading raunchy photos can be viewed legally as violating child pornography laws, few prosecutors want to ruin a teenager’s life for a one-time display of immaturity.
